Description:
This festive season we’re building on the successes of the previous two years and raising money for the Trussell Trust — a brilliant charity that helps thousands of people in the UK feed their families in times of crisis via foodbanks. Last year, the Trussell Trust network gave out over 1.6 million three-day emergency food supplies to people in need, that’s a 19% increase on the previous financial year.

When we started raising money for the Trussell Trust in 2017, 13 million people were living below the poverty line. Two years on, this number has grown to 14 million. People are going hungry every day for a range of reasons, from benefit delays (due to a drastically underfunded switch to universal basic income) to receiving an unexpected bill on a low income. This number is growing for a multitude of reasons but the responsibility lies in the same place each time. Our current government is failing us.

Winter is always the busiest period for foodbanks, so we’d like your help to raise as much cash as possible. A tin of beans costs as little as 30p, so any donation you make however small or large will really help!

We wish that each year we wouldn't need to fundraise for this cause, it shouldn’t be down to the Trussell Trust (and many other similar organisations), there should be a system that supports and cares for people.

Please share this on all of your social platforms to help us achieve our goal. Then, on December the 12th please vote for a change — the right are failing us all, but most importantly, they're failing those who are in need of a social care system that works.

Thank you, we couldn’t do this without you!
Title: Festive Food Bank Fundraiser 2019

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.

As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Title: Covid19 Food Bank

Description:
In the UK more than 14 million people are living in poverty - including 4.5 million children. Since the outbreak of Covid-19, the situation has only escalated for millions of families. In light of the government's decision not to provide free school meals for children during the holidays, I thought I'd put together a Just Giving page to raise money for The Trussell Trust. Last year, food banks in this charity's network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of those went to children. Hopefully, by raising some money we can help to relieve some of the financial pressure that the school holidays bring. There's no pressure to donate but any donation would be greatly appreciated!

All the best, 

Charlie x
Title: Food Bank Donation

Description:
A year ago, I was the Labour Party's General Election candidate for Dudley South. During my campaign I talked to hundreds of local families, many of whom shared with me how difficult it is to make ends meet. One young mum, on a bitterly cold day, told me she only had 80p left on her electricity meter and another spoke about how much harder it is in school holidays when her kids aren't getting fed at school. 

This was a year ago.

Since then, Coronavirus is pushing more families into poverty.

There are over 2,000 children in receipt of Free School Meals in Dudley South and many thousands more across the Black Country more widely. I would like to raise some funds to help the local food bank support them and their families this half-term and beyond.

Thank you for your support

Title: Danielle's 2020 food bank appeal

Description:
In the UK there has been a 23% increase in the use of food banks. With the devastating effect of the Coronavirus on peoples jobs and income, the reliance of food banks has become far more evident. Latest figures by Independent Food Aid Network (IFAN) show a 177% increase in the number of people supported with 3-day emergency food parcels compared to May of last year.

Humanity First has set up its first UK Food Bank in Mirfield, West Yorkshire. A further roll out of other food banks is expected later this year. With local support they have managed to distribute food parcels to individuals and families as well as other food banks and organisations reaching a large number of people. 

However, to increase and expand the operation much needed donations required. 

£25 could feed a family in the UK for a week
£50 could feed a family in the UK for 2 weeks
£100 could feed a family in the UK for a month

Please support our Food Bank effort and donate today!

Title: Mer-crow to support food banks

Description:
Thank you for supporting S6 Foodbank. Every donation made goes directly to support their work.

Without the assistance of people and businesses in Sheffield, S6 Foodbank wouldnt be able to continue to support their guests, launch new sites and tackle the ongoing food crisis in Sheffield which is being exacerbated by coronavirus.

S6 Foodbank are expecting the increased need to continue for the foreseeable future, as more people experience difficulty as a result of coronavirus and its wider consequences. I believe that nobody in Sheffield should have to face going hungry. 

A donation of £27 provides food and basic essentials for a family of three for three days. I am aiming to raise at least £40 to help S6 Foodbank reach their £40,000 target. Whatever I raise (up to that target) will be match-funded by the Government via the Love Your Neighbour partnership, meaning S6 Foodbank receives double the amount.

Thank you for sponsoring me, and a huge thank you too from Chris and the team
Title: Anna's Stepping Out for S6 Food Bank

Description: We are an independent local foodbank in Hornsey, which opens once a week to give food to local residents in need. We do not operate a voucher system, anybody who feels they need it can use our service. We try to offer fresh as well as non-perishable food where we can. Over the summer we have been located in Campsbourne School, and from September we will be located in Middle Lane Methodist Church. We grew out of Hornsey Mutual Aid, a group of local residents set up to help people in need during the COVID-19 Pandemic. We noticed a high degree of food poverty, and no foodbanks operate in the Hornsey area, so we got together to start this foodbank. All proceeds will go towards supporting the food bank. We are a very new venture, and while we work towards setting up our own structures, Hornsey Parochial Charities are kindly holding our money for us.

Description:
The UKSCF is working hard to provide funding to some of the most exciting stem cell research projects. The Foundation has provided funding for research into the treatment of Diabetes, as well as other life-threatening diseases.

Here at The Skinny Food Co, we were born with the intentions of making our products accessible to all lifestyles and diets, including Diabetes. Our directors, James & Wayne, both have family members who suffer from this condition and so they knew the struggle it was to find diabetic-friendly products on the market.

Diabetes is life-changing, but so could this fundraiser be. If you have spare change, we'd highly appreciate all the support you can give for research that could help the lives of those suffering from Diabetes.
Title: UKSCF x The Skinny Food Co

Description:
"Together, we will recover from this pandemic. Together, we can create an even stronger society. Together, we know this can change."

Firstly thank you for visiting this page.


As a community we always pull together to help others I have set up this page to help contritube to the vast growing demand of this vital service in Harrogate and surrounding areas.

I have been collecting donations and food parcels from friends and the word seems to be spreading with this I have set up a central point for donations. 

Thank you in advance for your kindness and generosity for what is a very difficult time for many.

Please read the statement below:


In the last few months, we’ve all been hit by something outside our control. As the coronavirus pandemic has swept in, its impact has been felt by all of us, in many different ways.

More and more of us are facing financial insecurity, a loss of control, an uncertainty over what our futures might look like.

But while we’re all being hit by the same storm, we’re not all in the same boat. For some, this sweeping lack of control is new and unsettling. For some, this will be a one-off occurrence from which they’ll recover. But for people living in poverty, this feeling isn’t new. It’s all too familiar.

Feeling trapped, facing limited options, and being let down by systems designed to provide support is the norm for millions of people every day.

In the first two weeks of the pandemic, food banks in our network reported an 81% increase in need compared to the same period last year – that’s more than 6,250 food parcels every day, with close to 3,000 of these for children. And as the outbreak continues to develop, it’s likely that more and more people are going to need to use a food bank.

Many Thanks
Kerri
Title: Kerri's Harrogate Community Food Bank Donations

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, this year has been one of the hardest years for many people.
People losing their jobs, pay cuts, redundancy, businesses closing. These times would be hard for anyone, but especially those who have young families, and are finding it difficult to provide for themselves and their children. I don’t know about you, but as a young family myself who is able to support; there’s nothing worse than knowing of those who are not being able to provide for those we love and care for the most.

We here at PLS would like to help those most in need and make sure those families are able to go to places like the Black Country Food Bank, and make sure they have food on the table.

We have decided to make a donation page for anyone who would like to donate financially.

Thank you to anyone and everyone for any support shown. ❤️🌸
Title: Amii's Black Country Food Bank

Description:
iQra International are doing their part in helping end child poverty. During this half term. Please share the word and help us raise for this cause. We have created food packs with the most basic necessities. 

Each child relies on food and this should not have been put to a vote in regards to free school meals. We want to make sure children do not go hungry during the holidays. 

Collection point: 214 whitechapel Road E1 1BJ

Contact: 0207 790 7744 or email info@iqrainternational for a collection.

Food Bank opening hours: Monday to Friday 10 AM to 3 PM. 26.10.2020 to 01.11.2020.
Title: Help iQra's Food Bank Reduce Child Poverty

CharityName: St John the Evangelist, Brownswood Park
Description:
Throughout the pandemic Ows and I have been collecting from our neighbours for our local foodbank. We have now been collecting weekly since May and the need keeps growing; with a 50% increase in people using the food bank, this is only set to increase as more people lose their jobs. 

This is why I have decided to make a pretty cold and miserable month a tad more gruelling by running 5k a day throughout November, to raise money for the St John's Soup Kitchen and Foodbank. I will be putting my knees on the line so please donate to this great cause. Also, if you're  in the area please feel free to join me on a run, there will be 30 to choose from. 

Help St John's to keep running our soup kitchen and food bank. They have given out 2000 meals since the beginning of April, and are now giving out 100 food parcels a week. They are a non-referral service, and will help anyone who comes to their doors.
Title: 5K a day for St John's Soup Kitchen and Food Bank

Description:
Thank you to everyone who has donated to this campaign, without the support of so many of you we would not have been able to continue, launch new sites and ultimately address the immediate food crisis caused by coronavirus.

As the coronavirus crisis has continued, we have experienced a huge increase in need. To illustrate this, prior to the crisis our busiest week was in December 2019, where we supported 117 individuals and families across four foodbanks.  In the last week of April 2020, just one of our seven foodbanks supported 126 individuals and families. This increase in need means our weekly food bill would be almost £8,000, should we need to purchase it, not to mention staffing, transport and equipment.  

Sadly, we are expecting this increased need to continue for the foreseeable future as more people experience difficulty as a result of coronavirus and its wider consequences.  We still don’t think anyone in our community should have to face going hungry. That’s why we asking you to support us to continue to provide three days’ nutritionally balanced emergency food to local people, in the initial crisis, through 2020 and beyond!

Sometimes the numbers involved can seem daunting so we’ll make it simple - £27 provides food and basic essentials for a family of three.

Thank so much for all your support, love and encouragement – S6 foodbank!

Title: Support Nourish Community Food Bank in Tunbridge Wells this half term

Description:
In these difficult times, lets look out for one another. Food banks will become ever more important this winter, any donations will go directly to New Hope Food Bank who help support those in need of a proper meal.

This November I will be going vegetarian to raise money for the New Hope Food Bank. As a lot of you will know I very much enjoy eating meat so this month will be a challenge, yet a good opportunity to discover some tasty vegetarian meals that will inevitably reduce my meat consumption! Joining me on this challenge are Libby,Tom &Tan, with my parents doing every other day as veggie!

Along with going Vegetarian Andrew and I will be participating in Movember.

Any support and donations will be very much appreciated ( As will good veggie recipes...). Whatever you can give will really make a difference.

Many thanks,

Dan
Title: Foodbank appeal

Description:
Skipton Food Bank provides food parcels to people across Craven - the rural area in which I live. 19% of children live in poverty, which is obscured by the rural ideal promoted by tourism. The food bank helps all in my local community at difficult times. I would like to support it through your enjoyment of my art.

The food bank is very small charity - part of Skipton Baptist Church - and is run by volunteers, with a part-time paid manager. The pandemic has made their vital work even more important and challenging. Please give what ever you can afford to help.

The film can be viewed at www.leedsandliverpool.co.uk

Title: Chris's Movember for food

Description:
Our Food Bank will be open more frequently over the next few weeks. We will be open at our Gunwharf location from 11am-12noon Monday-Thursday and our usual time of 4-6pm on Thursdays.

We are open for those with Trussell trust food bank vouchers, as well as anybody else who is struggling to access basic food and household items. Alongside being able to access the food bank during our opening hours, people are able to email or call to request a food parcel delivered to their front door.

If you are able, we need donations! Tinned goods, pasta, loo roll, rice, cereal, jarred sauces, UTH milk and more. You can bring in donations during any of our opening hours.

Money that you donate will allow us to keep up our stocks of food and toiletries which are making a huge difference to those in our City who need it.

Title: Fundraiser for HF Food Bank Appeal

Description: The last few months have seen immense suffering and hardship from storms and flooding. However the outbreak of the Coronavirus has quite literally changed everyones lives and turned society upside down.However, The Salvation Army is resolute and strong and just as we did in the Spanish Flu pandemic, and during the bombing and the Blitz we will carry on, doing what we can to support people and communities in the ways that we can, within the Government guidelines.In true Salvation Army Spirit, our greatest strength is our flexible, responsive local presence. Right now, each of our 650 corps and community centres will know exactly what the most effective things are to do. We are not just responding to the virus impact in one or two ways, but dozens and dozens of different ways, from food banks to counselling, from supporting NHS isolation units to checking up on people who are living alone Please give what you can to enable us to help as many people as possible! Southwick Community Project is collecting donations to buy food for vulnerable people in our community who are struggling during the coronavirus pandemic £20 can provide a box of essentials for a family of 4.

Description:
The Salvation Army is a Christian Church & registered
Charity working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. Feltham Salvation Army has been open as a Church and serving the community for nearly 100 years, including through the provision of practical support in times of need.

We are working with Feltham Foodbank, Riverside Vineyard Storehouse, Christ Church Feltham and other local organisations to distribute food packs for households at risk of food poverty during the COVID-19 response.  Please support us if you can.
Title: Emergency Food Bank

Description:
I wanted to use my spare time and crafting skills to find a way to help in these uncertain times.

I have hand made these bookmarks from vintage fabric and fabric remnants. Get some for your lockdown reading. Or send some as a gift to your friends, lovers or book club buddies.

They are available in different prints including vintage, Liberty, Orla Kiely. (Recommended donation £10 for 2)

The donations will go towards The Trussell Trust who operate a network of food banks across the country, and aim to end hunger and poverty in the U.K. The use of food banks has increased as people continue to face the consequences of the current economic crisis. Your donations will help these food banks provide support to those in need. Thank you for your support. 

Make sure to select the option to share your details with me so I can contact you for the delivery address. Or send me an e-mail at bookmarks.fundraiser@gmail.com.

U.K. and International deliveries are possible.

I cannot access your e-mail and address through the website so please remember to e-mail. 

+ For gifts, I can print any messages you want to send along.

+ The colours and patterns sent will be a surprise, but if you have any requests feel free to include a note.

Thank you again!

More information about The Trussell Trust: The Trussell Trust, in conjunction with local communities, develops and runs sustainable projects in the UK tackling poverty and exclusion. Through the UK Foodbank Network and Community Enterprises we work with marginalised people in real need, providing practical care and support. www.trusselltrust.org. Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us.

Title: Food bank challenge

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

SUSTAIN Food Bank is run by Tonbridge Baptist Church for those living in Tonbridge and surrounding areas facing food poverty.  We rely on donated items from generous local people, schools and businesses. Non-perishable food can be dropped off at Tonbridge Baptist Church 9.30am-4.30pm Monday to Friday. However, the current need exceeds the supply of donated items. This appeal will help us purchase additional food items when they are needed most.

We are concerned about the impact of the Coronavirus outbreak on those needing to use food banks and we are taking extra measures to ensure the most vulnerable in our community can still access food.

Each week SUSTAIN provides an average of 80 emergency food parcels. A family parcel costs £50 and an individual parcel costs £25 to put together, a total cost of between £2,000 - £2,500 each week.  Your donation would go towards ensuring we can continue to provide emergency food during this difficult time.

All donations to SUSTAIN are ring fenced and restricted for the work of SUSTAIN.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to SUSTAIN. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

Title: Food Banks in Scotland

Description: We are an independent local foodbank in Hornsey, which opens once a week to give food to local residents in need. We do not operate a voucher system, anybody who feels they need it can use our service. We try to offer fresh as well as non-perishable food where we can. Over the summer we have been located in Campsbourne School, and from September we will be located in Middle Lane Methodist Church. We grew out of Hornsey Mutual Aid, a group of local residents set up to help people in need during the COVID-19 Pandemic. We noticed a high degree of food poverty, and no foodbanks operate in the Hornsey area, so we got together to start this foodbank. All proceeds will go towards supporting the food bank. We are a very new venture, and while we work towards setting up our own structures, Hornsey Parochial Charities are kindly holding our money for us.
Title: Hornsey Food Bank

Description:
The last few months have seen immense suffering and hardship from storms and flooding. However the outbreak of the Coronavirus has quite literally changed everyones lives and turned society upside down.However, The Salvation Army is resolute and strong and just as we did in the Spanish Flu pandemic, and during the bombing and the Blitz we will carry on, doing what we can to support people and communities in the ways that we can, within the Government guidelines.In true Salvation Army Spirit, our greatest strength is our flexible, responsive local presence. Right now, each of our 650 corps and community centres will know exactly what the most effective things are to do. We are not just responding to the virus impact in one or two ways, but dozens and dozens of different ways, from food banks to counselling, from supporting NHS isolation units to checking up on people who are living alone Please give what you can to enable us to help as many people as possible.

Here at Dinnington we have been running a food bank for over 10 years. We are working hard to keep the food bank going through these very trying times but this is when we are needed more than ever. We would like to thank all those who already support us either in time, money or general food donations.

We are raising money to keep the food bank going to support the ever growing numbers of people in need in our community, All the money raised here will all go to the work here in our area.

A big thank you goes out to all that have supported us so far, but we are still working as hard supporting the local community.

﻿

﻿

Title: Supporting food banks

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange.

It is clear that the COVID-19 pandemic is already having a negative impact on the lives of many people. With financial hardship and economic uncertainty becoming a significant issue, colleges up and down the country are looking for ways to support their staff, students and communities.


With this in mind, London South East Colleges launched ‘FE Foodbank Friday’ - in partnership with FE Week - to support the people in our communities who need it most. The initiative, established on 20th March 2020, saw great success in supporting local food banks in South East London.


As a supporter of the initiative we hope to replicate this success in our own local area and become part of a national movement where colleges across the UK support their local communities through the coronavirus crisis and beyond.


Therefore, we pledge to join the FE Foodbank Friday Initiative – supporting our own communities and replicating the success we have had so far to provide help where it's most needed.


The College is a major partner in our local community, and we want to do all that we can to support it. By supporting this initiative, we can ensure that the most vulnerable people in our communities are well looked-after and all of us can make it through this pandemic.


As colleges across the UK unite to improve the lives of our communities, we hope that we can continue to provide this support going forward.
Title: Food bank Friday

Description:
WE ARE NO LONGER TAKING ORDERS (THOUGH DONATIONS ARE OF COURSE STILL APPRECIATED). THANK YOU FROM THE BOTTOM OF OUR HEARTS FOR ALL OF YOUR SUPPORT. WITHOUT YOU WE COULD NOT HAVE RAISED £2,250! 


We’re raising money by selling scrunchies for the Trussell Trust, a charity supporting a network of over 1,200 food banks in the UK. The work the Trussell Trust does is essential: providing food and support to the most vulnerable people in society. Their work is currently as important as ever, with the coronavirus crisis worsening the effects of poverty.


Our scrunchies are handmade using repurposed materials that have kindly been donated to us - a symbol of togetherness. This makes them unique but also means that there is only a limited number of each style. We will therefore be accepting sales on a first-come-first-serve basis.


How it works:

1. Let us know via personal message or through our Instagram (@scrunchies4foodbanks) your favourite pattern(s) so that we can reserve them before purchase. To view close-up pictures please click the gallery icon at the top right-hand corner of the cover photo

2. Donate (£5 minimum per scrunchie)

3. Send us proof of your donation

4. Tell us your address

5. Your scrunchie will be on its way – by foot (if local) and second class post (if not)! Please bear with us as we are making them all by hand, though rest assured they will be posted as soon as they are ready


All funds raised will go straight to the Trussell Trust, helping to fight hunger and poverty.


Thank you, and stay safe!


Beth and Helen x


*** 2 (Bethany), 3 (Margaid), 7 (Daisy), 9 (Helen), 10 (Katie), 12 (Grace), 14 (Annabel), 15 (Ella), 20 (Bella), 22 (Lilia), 23 (Dolly), 29 (Lily) and 30 (Kate) now sold out

Title: Hornsey Food Bank

Description:
In the UK there has been a 23% increase in the use of food banks. With the devastating effect of the Coronavirus on peoples jobs and income, the reliance of food banks has become far more evident. Latest figures by Independent Food Aid Network (IFAN) show a 177% increase in the number of people supported with 3-day emergency food parcels compared to May of last year.

Humanity First has set up its first UK Food Bank in Mirfield, West Yorkshire. A further roll out of other food banks is expected later this year. With local support they have managed to distribute food parcels to individuals and families as well as other food banks and organisations reaching a large number of people. 

However, to increase and expand the operation much needed donations required. 

£25 could feed a family in the UK for a week
£50 could feed a family in the UK for 2 weeks
£100 could feed a family in the UK for a month

Please support our Food Bank effort and donate today!

Title: Masjid Aisha Food bank

Description:
If anyone would like a portrait please email me a photograph of yourself (or whoever you want a portrait of) and specify which size you would like. A5 or A4 would be £10 and A3 would be £20. All this money will go to charity, so please consider buying one! I have attached some examples of my previous portraits of friends and others.

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Title: Food Bank Appeal from EMS for NYC

Description:
The Salvation Army is a Christian Church & registered Charity working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, homeless people, all adult victims of modern slavery and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction.  

During the COVID-19 Pandemic, we have seen unprecedented demand for our Foodbank.  Please help us to help the local community by providing food for those who are unable to supply al that they need.  Thank you.

Description:

If you’d like to get involved, you can donate on this page or even pick up an extra item from the following list during your weekly shop and I’ll collect and make sure it gets to where it is needed.

Urgently needed food items:

•    Sugar (500g)
•    Tinned fruit
•    Milk (UHT or powdered)
•    Long life fruit juice
•    Toiletries
•    Pasta sauces
•    Cereals

Love to you all,

Hay x

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit the Investec Be. Movember 2020 JustGiving page.

It'll be the most important mo you every grow

Movember is a global community of fired up Mo Bros and Mo Sisters – aka rock stars making a difference in mental health and suicide prevention, prostate cancer and testicular cancer.


Last year, 16 Investec Mo champions helped us raise over £2000 for Movember with their powerful upper-lip accessory. It commands attention, demands a double-take and compels lifesaving conversations. This year it’s more important than ever.

Investec Be. in partnership with the Investec Gender Balance network and International Men's Day (19 November), we are once again searching for the greatest ‘tash in banking to raise awareness of men's health issues. Throughout November we're looking to follow the journeys of our Investec Movember champions in all UK offices to crown one "The Investec 'Tash King".

Please share this page with friends, family and colleagues.

Your support is greatly appreciated.

Above Movember

Our fathers, partners, brothers and friends are facing a health crisis, yet it’s rarely talked about. Men are dying too young. We can’t afford to stay silent.We are the leading charity changing the face of men’s health. We know what works for men – and what doesn’t. Prostate cancer, testicular cancer, mental health and suicide prevention – we’re taking them all on.Since 2003, Movember has funded more than 1,250 men’s health projects around the world, challenging the status quo, and shaking up men’s health research.

Title: Helping Food Banks this Winter

Description:
For all of us, there are a fair few things we thought we'd be doing this year, that never actually happened. For a lot of people, this pandemic has also meant they are doing things they never thought they would have to.


Like relying on a food bank to feed their family.
In spring 2020, 50% of people who were visiting Trussell Trust food banks were doing so for the very first time. The Trussell Trust network are expecting to hand out six emergency food parcels every minute throughout winter.


On Sunday, I am doing something I would never have done if it weren’t for the pandemic. I’ll be running the Virtual “New York” Marathon and I want to use this as an opportunity to raise some money for those who really need it.


If you can afford to, please do pop a few pounds in to the fundraising page. It will be my fifth time running the marathon distance, but definitely the most difficult…

I’ll be running in intervals with a half mile walking break every four miles, I’m expecting to be at least an hour slower than my fastest marathon time, and instead of following the thousands of people in front of me, I’ll have to remember where I’m going all by myself!


If you are around on Sunday and fancy giving me a cheer, let me know and I can share my route and rough times I’ll be expecting to pass by

Title: Allstate Trivia Event

Description:
Save the Mothers Trust (SMT) jointly with Bradford Central Lions Club launched its Food Bank in March 2014 to provide food and support to those less fortunate and in need. The Food Bank is located at the SMT head office in Bradford, West Yorkshire. Since the launch of the Food Bank, it has served many individuals as well as families with young children who are suffering extreme hardships due to cut backs in the benefit system. Some of these people have not eaten for several days and have struggled due to the lack of basic amenities such as heating and electricity. We continuously require items to place in food parcels or cash donations to purchase them. We would appreciate your co-operation in achieving our goal to serve the needy, thereby gaining reward from Allah (SWT).
Donate from as little as £5 per month or £30 to provide one food parcel
Title: SMT Food Bank (UK)

Description: I have been following the news, and wanted to do something for all those people who have lost their jobs because of Covid-19. So, I am aiming to raise £1000 for Food Banks UK, by completing the fictional river journey along the Thames that the famous book Three Men in a Boat completed. The course is from Kingston-upon-Thames to Oxford. I will be simulating the 90mile journey on a rowing machine.
Title: SMT Food Bank (UK)

Description:
The Coronavirus is already having a hugely negative economic and social impact across the UK, whether that’s job uncertainty or self-isolation preventing many vulnerable people from buying the basic items they need.

As an education provider Bournemouth & Poole College wants to engage with our community to help raise awareness and funds to help people through these trying times.

We are working hard to ensure we have a real, positive impact on the lives of our local communities. We have the resources and the fantastic staff to help make it happen.

That is why we are joining FE colleges nationally in the FE Food Bank Friday initiative. Since the programme started on Friday 20 March many colleges across the country are pledging to take part.

As staff and students are now working and studying remotely, it is becoming difficult for staff and students to physically donate any items. That is why we have joined this fundraising campaign, which aims to raise £2,000 so that foodbanks can continue to operate despite social distancing taking place across the country.

About The Trussell Trust

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange.
Title: FE Food Bank Friday

Description:
14 sets available, suggested donation £8 for set of three (feel free to give more!). Please comment with your address or email me at Hannah.dart@outlook.com and I will deliver by foot on my exercise walks or by car when driving for work but ONLY WITHIN BRIGHTON AND HOVE. You can also come and collect from Hanover. 

 Are you looking for ways to reduce your impact on the environment? Or help those who use for banks access the food they need? 

I've made some lovely reusable beeswax foodwraps to raise money for the Trussel Trust who run food banks across the country including the one in Whitehawk. Food banks and the people who use them need our help more than ever as donations have reduced and so many people are facing poverty because they are unable to work in our current lockdown.

Each set includes 1x large rectangle (45x26cm) 1x small rectangle (28x15 cm) 1x circle (diameter 29cm). Homemade with cotton and beeswax. Use to wrap sandwiches or peices of food, to cover pots or dishes of leftovers etc. Wipe clean after use. When they start to look over-used simply sandwich each one between two pieces of baking paper and iron, they'll come out good as new! Please note that although I am fastidious with hand hygiene I have handled these wraps and I'd advise you wipe them down with soapy water (don't soak them just wipe) when you receive them.

Pattern options: Vegetables/Farm or Blue & Yellow

A note from The Trussel Trust: Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Food Wraps for Food Banks

Description:
Save the Mothers Trust (SMT) jointly with Bradford Central Lions Club launched its Food Bank in March 2014 to provide food and support to those less fortunate and in need. The Food Bank is located at the SMT head office in Bradford, West Yorkshire. Since the launch of the Food Bank, it has served many individuals as well as families with young children who are suffering extreme hardships due to cut backs in the benefit system. Some of these people have not eaten for several days and have struggled due to the lack of basic amenities such as heating and electricity. We continuously require items to place in food parcels or cash donations to purchase them. We would appreciate your co-operation in achieving our goal to serve the needy, thereby gaining reward from Allah (SWT).
Donate from as little as £5 per month or £30 to provide one food parcel
Title: SMT Food Bank (UK)

Description:
As you may know, Brent is one of the most deprived boroughs in London and the most affected by coronavirus. Many families are living in poverty and reliant on food banks. 

Last year, the Trussell Trust food banks provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. And last month the need for family food parcels went up by 107%.

Since the start of lockdown neighbours from the Queen's Park area in North West London have come together and donated hundreds of items to food banks every week. But with potential redundancies around the corner we want to help feed our neighbours to make sure no one goes hungry. 

100% of your donation goes straight to charity. Thank you so much for your help!

Title: Raising Money For Food Banks

Description:
Dale’s Food Bank Awareness & The Need to Consider Others

It has come to this time of year where all of us look forward to and I'm sure some more than others. We look forward to spending time with families and loved ones and share our time and gifts with the people we love.

For three to four years now, I have been myself making a conscious effort to donate to my local food bank  http://www.fareshare.org.uk/regional-centres/kent/
and particularly at Christmas time. Christmas should be a special time for everyone and not just the more fortunate ones of us, it is the time of year where everyone deserves a break or a help in hand. I always make a conscious effort to visit the my local supermarket with an amount of money in mind that I can afford or spare for someone that I believe would be grateful of this type of gift at such an important time of year.

I myself and as I believe most of us do, know how it feels when times are hard; when you have to consider each and every pound you have to spend. Although my situation has improved over time I will never stop considering or donating to others less fortunate than myself. There is not a day that goes by that I don’t appreciate how lucky I am and believe that everyone should.

While reading this can I ask you just to take a few moments to consider how it would make you feel particularly at Christmas time if you were :  

  • A senior citizen with little or no family and most of all no idea where the next
    meal will come from?
  • Or maybe a young family with only enough money to afford the weekly essentials /
    basics and no idea how you will afford the niceties / basics for Christmas.
  • Or Maybe a homeless person with nowhere to live no family and most of all no idea
    where or even how you will find the next meal.

May I now ask you a question:

  • How would it make you feel if you or any of your loved ones were in any of the above positions and what it would feel like to receive a welcomed donation of a food parcel that ultimately has come from someone that has considered your position and wanted to give something back. I'm sure it would be an emotional roller-coaster moment where you can for at least once a year rest easy and enjoy this special time of year.

With just under 7 weeks left until Christmas, can i ask for your consideration if you could afford £1 per week which will give between £5 -£7 pounds worth of goods which would buy:

23 Packets of pasta

or

29 Tins of baked beans

or 

14 Cartons of long life milk

or 

1120 tea bags

I really do appreciate you taking the time to read this and hope you found this of interest. PLEASE PLEASE do share this with as many people as possible to help raise awareness to the food-bank and what it would actually mean to the recipient. 

I myself will be volunteering in my local supermarket and carrying out my yearly Christmas shop. If you would like to get involved and help me give something back to the ones in need and appreciate the thoughts behind this post you can donate on the below just giving page of which will be directed to http://www.fareshare.org.uk/


Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

Title: SMT Food Bank (UK)

Description:
On the 15th November 2016, I will commence a 24 hour fast in aid of the Trussell Trust. The rules are simple.

1) During this time, I can consume no food, only water, not even coffee! 

2) I will stick to my regular routine as much as possible to show a spirit of solidarity with people living with food poverty, who have to carry on living their lives regardless of this insecurity.

3) I will narrate my experience by regularly updating my Twitter feed throughout the day to remain accountable to people who have kindly donated.

This effort is partly due to the benefits cap which comes into force today, 7th November 2016. The explicit aim of this policy is to 'incentivize' unemployed people into work [http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-37873922]. It is ideologically motivated, responding to the myth that being on benefits is a lifestyle choice, and will disproportionately affect single mothers and larger families as a result [http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/families-set-to-lose-100-a-week-under-chilling-new-benefit-cap-theresa-may-george-osborne-a7401681.html]. According to the Institute for Fiscal Studies, savings made from this measure are likely to be offset by emergency hardship payments made to those struggling to pay their rent [http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/11/07/new-cap-on-benefit-payments-will-only-result-in-trivial-savings/].

My day of willingly foregoing food is nothing compared to the food insecurity and poverty that thousands of people are forced to undergo on a regular basis. The benefits cap will erode the physical and mental health of individuals and families, including those who are already suffering, and represents a shocking assault on human dignity. Clearly, food banks are not a whole solution to this issue. However, they can offer two powerful sustenances: food and hope.

If you decide not to donate to this page or are not able to at this time, please consider adding a couple of extra items to your weekly shop in future and donating them to your local food bank. Information on UK food banks and more on the Trussell Trust's activities can be found here: https://www.trusselltrust.org/

Thank you.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Liz's Fast for Food Banks

Description:
Three unassuming lads who drunkenly signed up to run a half marathon now find themselves going bald to shave mere seconds off of their 10K times. Why, you ask? For food banks. Unfortunately, the Hackney Half Marathon event this Sunday was cancelled (even though we would have been able to maintain a government sanctioned two metre lead), but we didn't want to throw a good thing away. Now more than ever there are vulnerable people in society that need your help if you're able to give it, and we would be immensely appreciative if you could donate the cost of that pint that you haven't been able to buy this week. We are each donating £20. Details on the Trussell Trust are as follows:

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year. Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure. They are working closely with their network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how they can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that they're able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

It's times like these that you learn to give again. 

For a bonus - if we hit £200...

Andy "I would only eat a scotch bonnet if you paid me £2000" Donnan will eat a whole habanero pepper (with milk)

Matt "mushrooms are like slugs and make me gag" Wright will eat three raw portobello mushrooms

Jack "OoooO thats spicy" Cundall will eat a whole brown onion raw

Title: SMT Food Bank (UK)

Description:
"Be the change that you wish to see in the world" MK Gandhi. 

In these uncertain and difficult times, we would like to extend our support to those who are struggling for the very basic human need - FOOD. This is a call to everyone out there to do their part and help feed those who need food for survival in these uncertain times. 

Please contribute and help us feed people in need - those who are vulnerable and struggling to meet the basic needs to survive the lockdown and economic hardships this pandemic has unleashed. We are doing this fundraising with the objective of buying the required supply for the food bank so that it can reach the people in need of food.

Sewa means 'selfless service'. 

Sewa Day (a charity registered in England & Wales, No. 1146848) promotes selfless service through local volunteering projects which benefit those around us. Thousands of good-hearted people across the world come together to perform Sewa and experience the joy of giving in its truest sense. By participating in this collective endeavour, we hope that the seeds of Sewa are watered so that acts of kindness and public service are performed more often. Sewa Day is a catalyst in making this happen.

Visit us at https://sewaday.org to find more about us.
Title: Food Bank COVID19 response

Description:
Fundraising for foodbanks

I am writing this because now is a time of crisis.  More than 14 million people live in poverty in the UK and 4.5 million of these are children.  People who have always been in need especially require help right now.  

I am raising money for food banks which help people get emergency food.

Imagine if that was you or your relatives?  Wouldn’t you like someone to help you and support you in your time of need?

Please could you sponsor my attempt to run/walk 23.1 km in 7 days around my garden inspired by Captain Tom’s effort?
Title: Callum's fundraising for food banks

Description:
My name is Charlie Morton and I am 8 years old and live in Liverpool.  Lots of people are struggling during the Coronavirus because they have lost their jobs and may not have enough food for their families anymore.  I wanted to help by raising money for them so their bodies can still have the right food to help them stay strong!

I will be cycling and running 50 km starting on Monday 11th of May and finishing on Sunday 17th May.

I hope you might have some spare money to donate to this cause!

Title: Stoke-on-Trent food bank

Description:
Every Sunday at Re:Hope we collect food and toiletries in our donation baskets. These are distributed by the  team at Govan Community Project, who help to address the poverty and destitution that many asylum seekers face here in Glasgow by providing food parcels. 

Now are meeting online, and GCP have had to restructure their weekly collections. GCP have set up a Covid 19 crisis response fund to provide basic living essentials to their community and as a Church we want to continue supporting them. With basic essential items are harder to find in the shops, people are more isolated and vulnerable than ever.

So, if you would usually support the food bank by bringing along a tin or a packet - make your donation an online one this week instead! No donation is too small - every pound helps.

Govan Community Project Charity Registration No: SC042012

Description:
I've found it difficult to stay healthy over this lock down, with a family to look after and entertain. We're lucky to be able to eat but not all families are. Food banks desperately need donations of food and support in getting food where it is needed.

Sugarwise is a small charity supporting food banks with healthy food and contact free deliveries to individual homes.

I spoke with my mum on the phone yesterday, she said "why can't you be like that Captain who has raised millions!?" I said because that really is something special but all I can do is what I can. Doesn't mean it's not worth doing. I've set a £1000 goal and hope that I can hit it!

Good luck to everyone fundraising and participating in events tomorrow and in the coming weeks. 

Wish me luck!

Description:

Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Description:

Description:
Just £25 will buy a food parcel for a family of 4 each week.

After seeing on the news about the difficulties that so many families and children were in due to the way the COVID19 pandemic has affected peoples finances, I was inspired to volunteer with a new volunteer group called The Sikh Food Bank which provides weekly grocery boxes and hot meals to those in need. 

So far in 8 weeks we have served over 30,000 meals across Scotland to people from all backgrounds.
Title: Priya's Fundraising for The Sikh Food Bank

Description:
The last few months have seen immense suffering and hardship from storms and flooding. However the outbreak of the Coronavirus has quite literally changed everyones lives and turned society upside down.
However, The Salvation Army is resolute and strong and just as we did in the Spanish Flu pandemic, and during the bombing and the Blitz we will carry on, doing what we can to support people and communities  in the ways that we can, within the Government guidelines.
In true Salvation Army Spirit, our greatest strength is our flexible, responsive local presence. Right now, each of our 650 corps and community centres will know exactly what the most effective things are to do. We are not just responding to the virus impact in one or two ways, but dozens and dozens of different ways, from food banks to counselling, from supporting NHS isolation units to checking up on people who are living alone
Please give what you can to enable us to help as many people as possible!
Title: Newtown's Food Bank & Community Response

Description:
With your help, we can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. 

For a suggested donation of £50 I will sketch/paint a portrait. Once the donation is received you will be able to collect the painting from a safe location.

Email me at surbitonsketcher@gmail.com if you are interested. Together we can make a difference.

Instagram account: surbitonsketcher

Facebook: Surbiton sketcher

 The donation will go directly to CREst (Cambridge Road Estates Community Group), a charity that exists to look after the health and wellbeing of Cambridge Road Estate’s residents, has fed hundreds of local people in need since the beginning of lockdown three months ago.
• Within its first few weeks, the charity became so overwhelmed with requests for food from people from the wider Kingston area that it soon extended its offering to the wider Norbiton ward. 
• Listed in the top 2% of most deprived areas nationally with an estimated refugee population of 38%, the Cambridge Road Estates have been severely affected by the pandemic.
• As many food bank outlets in churches were forced to close their doors at the start of lockdown, volunteer-run CREstincreased its offering at Piper Hall to plug the gap and help vulnerable households across Norbiton during the pandemic.
• The charity currently feeds approximately 300people every week, with the numbers continuing to risesteadily.

Title: NCS The Callenge Team Edwards raise awarness for Trussell Trust Food Bank

Description:
We are reactivating our page for  our Harvest Appeal! During the last seven years Churches and Schools have been overwhelming in their generosity as they celebrate Harvest. This year many are unable to support by giving produce and has asked how else they might help. In response we have reactivated our Just Giving page.

The Salvation Army in Wickford manages the local Food Bank on behalf of the local churches. Volunteers are drawn from all churches in the town. We primarily help people in the post codes of SS11 and SS12. We are currently drawing down our food reserves to help others as much as we are able. In the current circumstances not surprisingly donations of food have declined. We are therefore trying to raise funds so that as our reserves deplete we will be able to go out and buy the food we need to keep this service going.

We thank the people of the town for their generous support over the last seven years, and for your ongoing support in these difficult days.
Title: Wickford 's Food Bank & People Support

Description:
In light of everything happening with coronavirus, I was reading up on homeless and vunerable people. While I am fortunate enough to have a house over my head, and I can almost be a little choosy with what food I do buy, there are many people out there who were already suffering with lack of food access. And that was even before covid19 came along. Over 80% of donations to the Trussell Trust are from the community and with everyone in lockdown, and many people bulk buying, or online shopping, there are less donations.

So, I want to do something small to see if I can make a little difference. I am going to get my mum to cut my hair short and would appreciate donations from friends and family, which will go to Trussell Trust.

Why cut my hair and not something else? Well, I will also be supporting The Little Pricess Trust - my hair will be cut to meet their guideleines and I will store it until they are ready to accept donations. I have a lot of hair, and if I am going to do something to raise money whilst self distancing and isolating, why not do as much as I can?

If every friend I had on FB, LinkedIn and Instagram donated £1, then I would smash this target easily. Please only donate what you are comfortable with - be that a price of a can of beans or £10.  It all adds up and will all help. I have put a target amount here but would love to exceed it with the generosity of friends and family (fingers crossed!).

I haven't had short hair for as long as I can remember. I have no idea how I will look and with everyone on lockdown, my mum will be my hairdresser (eek!). Doing it now also means that by the time I can see my husband (who is in isolation in the states whilst I am in the UK), maybe it won't look quite so bad...! Ah well!

Every donation will really help, so please spare what you can and share with your friends and family, so we can make sure the food banks have enough to help keep feeding those that are struggling.

I will share before and after pictures!

About Trussell Trust:

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Cathy's cutting her locks for food banks

Description:
The Coronavirus is having a hugely negative economic and social impact across the UK, whether that’s job uncertainty or self-isolation, preventing many vulnerable people from buying the basic items they need.

West London College is a large further education provider, comprised of 5 colleges: Hammersmith & Fulham College , Ealing Green College , Southall Community College , West London Construction Academy and Park Royal College . The college has over 11,000 students made up of those aged 16 - 18, adults, distance learning and online students, and apprentices


We are working hard to ensure we have a real, positive impact on the lives of our local communities. We have the resources and the fantastic staff and students to make it happen. That is why at West London College we are taking part in the FE Food Bank Friday initiative.


However, as staff and students are working and studying remotely, it is difficult to physically donate food items. So, we have started this fundraising campaign, which aims to raise £5,000 helping our local food banks to continue to operate.


We are asking anyone willing, during this very challenging time to donate what they can to help to ensure that we all can pull through this crisis together.


Thank you so much for your kind donation.

Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trust's network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: West London College is Supporting #FEFoodBank Friday

Description:
Hola hola,

Thanks for checking my fundraising page.

Foodbanks, unfortunately, have an increasingly big role in society. Last year, food banks in The Trussell Trust network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. 

COVID-19 has led to more families needing to access food, and this unprecedented demand is expected to rise by the end of the year.

I have decided to fundraise for this charity because:

1. Every society should be able to feed its population. Systemic change needs to happen, and The Trussell Trust campaigns and fights to change policies and systems, but,

2. In the meantime, and while we fight for change, no family, and no child, should be hungry. Everyone should have access to the basics.

I am now asking my contacts to donate to this charity via this fundraising page, and I, in turn, promise to match every pound (up to £300) and use the money I match to buy food, toiletries and baby products and to donate them to foodbanks, refuges and/or homeless shelters.

This means: If you donate £20 to The Trussell Trust via this fundraising page, you will be contributing towards their fight to ensure people in the UK can buy the essentials, but, in addition, £20 worth of food/toiletries/baby supplies will be donated in your name. If you add gift aid, your £20 donation to the charity becomes a £45 donation towards ending food poverty!

Thank you so much for joining me in this - it's such an important cause, and, while we won't end food poverty, every donation and bag of food we put together will bring us one step closer to making organisations like The Trussell Trust obsolete one day (because food banks should not be needed in the 21st century).

Note: I will start matching donations from mid-November to mid-January. I will post pictures of the donations I purchase as a consequence of your generosity. Most food/toiletries/baby products donations will go to The Trussell Trust foodbanks, but I will also research women refuge's and homeless shelters who may benefit from this support also. Thank you all again!

Note #2: If (if only!) we reach £300, you can continue donating and the money will still go to The Trussell Trust, it just won't be matched, but don't let that discourage you from supporting this wonderful charity!
Title: Amy's Winter Match Funding

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.


When I go to the supermarket, I often see posters appealing for people to donate food to the local food banks for people who are struggling. I see people outside with boxes to collect customers donations. It makes me sad when I am so privalled to know there are people out there who can barley afford a meal for their family! After seing the posters I have decided to try and help and do something about this issue. I know this won't solve all hunger but it will defintley help! I am collecting donations and then using the money to buy lots of cans of food to donate to a local food bank. I will be donating all the food brought from the money raised to the Trussel Trust in Uckfield. I hope I can help some people out there who really need it:) Please donate whatever you can, it will really make a difference! Thanks so much,

~Jasmine xx
Title: Jasmine's My food bank project

Description:
Christmas is a magical time for us at Jam Jar. As a family, we're surrounded by people we love and the magic of it all literally beams out of mini jam jar all the way through December. As a business we get to style some incredible events, and be surrounded by all that sparkles and shimmers. Sadly though, we know that many families on our own doorstep won't have the same feelings about Christmas. The dread of where to find the money for food shouldn't happen to anyone, at any time of year, but especially at christmas. As a mom, a wife and a business, I want to make a little difference to some of the families who need a bit of extra help this year.

I will be donating to the Black Country Food Bank on Tuesday 3rd Decemeber, and anything we raise on this page, I am aiming for £100 which I will match and buy additional donations. You can also leave donations at the studio too.

Please do share! The more of us who make a small donation will make a big difference.

Thanks guys xxx
Title: The Jam Jar Festive Food Bank Appeal

Description:
Across the UK 3 million children are at risk of suffering from hunger in
the school summer holidays.

The loss of a free school meal during the holidays can cost a family an extra £30 per child a week. Over the 6 weeks it’s estimated that a young person can lose half a stone if their parents can’t afford to feed them.

​30% of children in Greater Manchester live in poverty – that's 1 in 3. This
is why the summer is the busiest time for foodbanks.

We believe no one should have to go without food, so we're supporting
Hits Radio's appeal to the people of Manchester to 'Fill the Foodbanks'.

We’re collecting food donations at Bupa Place and VHC in Manchester but for those who can’t make a food donation you can make a cash donation instead here.

Thanks for your support!
Title: Bupa UK's Fill the Food Banks - Manchester

Description:
Food banks in east London are struggling in the wake of the Coronavirus outbreak. Donations are down 25% and with people panic-buying in supermarkets, important staples like UHT milk are difficult to come by. Also, low income families are struggling to provide food for children that would normally receive free school meals.

Food banks are a vital service for people experiencing food poverty caused by unemployment, low wages, benefit delay/changes, debt, or other personal crisis. From the food bank, individuals or families receive a nutritiously balanced food parcel, essential toiletries, and household items.

It's not right that people are going hungry. To combat this, our community partner, ELBA, is running a virtual food drive to support east London food banks during these challenging times. All money donated will be spent at a wholesalers to ensure food banks are well stocked and are able to support the most vulnerable people in society. Food purchased by ELBA will then be donated to our food bank partners.
Title: ELBA Virtual Food Drive

Description:
The Coronavirus is already having a hugely negative economic and social impact across the UK,whether that’s job uncertainty or self-isolation preventing many vulnerable people from buying the basic items they need.

The Nelson and Colne College Group – incorporating Nelson and Colne College, Accrington and Rossendale College and Lancashire Adult Learning – supports over 20,000 16-18 students, adult learners, Apprentices and HE students across Lancashire annually.

The Group is also sponsor of the multi-academy Pendle Education Trust, consisting of Colne Primet Academy, West Craven High School, Pendle Primary Academy, Castercliff Primary Academy and Casterton Primary Academy.

As an education provider the Nelson and Colne College Group wants to engage with our community to help raise awareness and funds to help people through these trying times. We are working hard to ensure we have a real, positive impact on the lives of our local communities. We have the resources and the fantastic staff to help make it happen.

That is why we are joining FE colleges nationally in the FE Food Bank Friday initiative. Since the programme started on Friday 20 March many colleges across the country are pledging to take part. Before the college sites closed, an appeal saw staff donating food and essential items to local food banks and over the holiday period, donating Easter eggs and
toiletries to a local refuge.


With staff and students now working and studying remotely, it is becoming difficult for staff and students to physically donate any items. That is why we have joined this fundraising campaign, which aims to raise £5,000 so that foodbanks can continue to operate despite social distancing taking place across the country.

We have set up pages for the following food banks covering our local community:

Inspiring Grace Nelson

https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/nelson-and-colne-college8

Community Kitchen and Food Bank, Burnley FC in the Community

https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/nelson-and-colne-college7

Maundy Relief, Accrington

https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/nelson-and-colne-college6

We are asking anyone willing during this extremely tough period to consider donating what they can to ensure that we all can pull through this crisis together.

Thank you so much for your kind donation.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Raising money to support local food banks #FE Food Bank Friday

Description:
The last few months have seen immense suffering and hardship from storms and flooding. However the outbreak of the Coronavirus has quite literally changed everyones lives and turned society upside down.
However, The Salvation Army is resolute and strong and just as we did in the Spanish Flu pandemic, and during the bombing and the Blitz we will carry on, doing what we can to support people and communities  in the ways that we can, within the Government guidelines.
In true Salvation Army Spirit, our greatest strength is our flexible, responsive local presence. Right now, each of our 650 corps and community centres will know exactly what the most effective things are to do. We are not just responding to the virus impact in one or two ways, but dozens and dozens of different ways, from food banks to counselling, from supporting NHS isolation units to checking up on people who are living alone
Please give what you can to enable us to help as many people as possible!
Title: Abertillery Corps's Community relief & Food bank page

Description:
The coronavirus pandemic has led to widespread consumer panic, driving prices and leading to massive shortages in essential products. Whilst for most people this is an inconvenience, for the most vulnerable members of society, this poses a genuine threat to their physical and economic safety.

In these times, more people than ever will be turning to homeless shelters and food banks. However, the rising prices and shortages mean that these causes are under an incredible financial pressure that the vast majority of these charities cannot shoulder. This means the vulnerable members of our communities will have nowhere left to turn.

However, we can make a genuine difference. By surrendering some of the stockpiles you may be privileged enough to have compiled, or donating your daily coffee money, you can make a real difference and support those charities that are going to be under the most pressure in these difficult times. Not only does this allow you to proactively mobilise on your concerns, but it will create an immediate physical and financial impact on the community.

As well as this page, we will also be running a food bank at Hills Road Sixth Form with the intention to bring the donations to local food banks. Please do what you can to make an enormous difference in your local community.

--

Title: Rebecca's Foodbank Collection

Description:
We are appealing for donations to the Trussell Trust to ensure they can continue distributing food to those living in poverty across the UK during the outbreak of the coronavirus. Many people rely on food banks to feed themselves and their families in times of need but due to the decrease of donations, as a result of the coronavirus, food banks are being forced to close- leaving people vulnerable without the support they so desperately need. 

Any donation no matter how big could make a huge difference in ensuring food banks can stay open and continue to provide for those living in poverty across the UK.

In the UK, more than 14 million people are living in poverty – including 4.5 million children. Trussell Trust support more than 1,200 food bank centres in the UK to provide a minimum of three days’ nutritionally-balanced emergency food to people who have been referred in crisis, as well as support to help people resolve the crises they face.
Title: Appealing for donations for the Trussell Trust

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.

As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: let's raise money for food banks during the covid-19 pandemic

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: Gary's Walk the UGP for food banks

At Barking Abbey School, we decided as a class to raise money and food for food banks across the U.K. We came together because we feel as though the government does not do enough to support food banks and the people who rely on them. Many food banks are undersupplied, therefore they have to send families away empty handed. 

Any support and donations would be highly appreciated, at a time like this during the coronavirus pandemic. Let's try to help as many families possible!
Title: Year 11 Barking Abbey - Food Bank Funding

Description:
Hi All - God willing, I will be doing a half marathon on Sat 3rd October in support of  Luton Food bank and Age Concern Luton. The severe impact of COVID-19 has resulted in an overwhelming increase in the number of people using food banks to get basic food items. I am completing this half Marathon to raise awareness and donations for these much needed community services.

We are blessed and fortunate if we are able to provide for ourselves and our families in these uncertain and unprecedented times.  Please support me as much as you can by donating to this cause. Thank you and God bless.
Title: Run for food bank and Age Concern

Description:
In the UK there has been a 23% increase in the use of food banks. With the devastating effect of the Coronavirus on peoples jobs and income, the reliance of food banks has become far more evident. Latest figures by Independent Food Aid Network (IFAN) show a 177% increase in the number of people supported with 3-day emergency food parcels compared to May of last year.

Humanity First has set up its first UK Food Bank in Mirfield, West Yorkshire. A further roll out of other food banks is expected later this year. With local support they have managed to distribute food parcels to individuals and families as well as other food banks and organisations reaching a large number of people. 

However, to increase and expand the operation much needed donations required. 

£25 could feed a family in the UK for a week
£50 could feed a family in the UK for 2 weeks
£100 could feed a family in the UK for a month

Please support our Food Bank effort and donate today!

Title: Fundraiser for HF Food Bank Appeal

Description:
Wath-upon-Dearne Salvation Army Corps run a Community Drop
in and a food bank for people who are struggling to provide food for themselves
and their families. In normal times we provide cooked food and25-30 food
parcels per week. We also provide emergency Food Parcels via referral
We are usually given food by several retailers but due to
the present situation we are struggling to obtain food. As well as food we
provide toiletries and women’s hygiene products. The coronavirus has also increased
need which makes it harder than ever to help everyone.


All of the money that is raised will be spent solely on
Food. We have no overhead costs and no paid staff.

If you are Able to help in any way we say a very grateful thank
you.

Title: Dorothy & Alan's Food Bank fundraiser

Description:
Hello,

This year for our Christmas appeal the IT Service Desk has chosen to collect food items for our local Foodbank, Leeds north and west http://leedsnorthandwest.foodbank.org.uk/.

 We are looking for donations of the following items:

 

A list of urgently needed food items are below:
