Title: Clare's page

Description:
In this period of Coronavirus lockdown there is increased pressure on the food banks for a variety of reasons:-

  • Unexpected job losses and increase in demand for supplies.
  • Regular donators being on lockdown.
  • Supermarket restrictions on purchasing multiple items.
  • Closure of many community buildings which act as drop off points for donations.

There is an amazing team of people working in the Bromley warehouse and in the centres, but they can only work with what has been donated.

Last year, food banks in their network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, they can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

I am hoping that I can help to raise funds to help them to keep supporting those that need them in the community.

I will buzz cut my hair to No. 6 all over if my full target is met. If I don't meet the target I should still like to keep your donations and would be happy to sport a suitable haircut commensurate with the amount raised - the more money, the more extreme. If I smash my target it could be a No 5 or shorter!!!

Please help.
Title: Miss Denton's 'Head Shave' Challenge

Description:
Food banks were important before, but they'll be even more essential during this Corona nightmare. 

So I'm letting 3 year old cassie try to shave my head. And I'll keep whatever that ends up with for at least 1 day, before I let my wife shave me number 1 bald.

Title: A 3 year old shaves Eoin's head

Description:
August 2021 update: I’ll be riding a 5-day bike tour around southern England, starting with a loop around the North Downs, then riding from Guildford to Salisbury, the New Forest, Portsmouth, round the Isle of Wight and back to Guildford. After such generous sponsorship last year, I’m not pushing for it this time but there remains great need for the Trussell Trust food banks, even more so now with supermarket shortages and Brexit price rises. So if you’ve made it here, please consider a kind donation while I ride with a strapped-up hamstring!

______________________________________________________

To mark turning 50, I’ve been planning to cycle the story of my life, from where I was born, Guisborough in the North Riding of Yorkshire, via all the places in this country I’ve lived in – taking in Kirby, Oxford, Reading, Guildford, Reigate and London – to end in Cambridge.

It was just going to be a personal challenge to mark a significant milestone. However, having spent my 50th birthday in the pandemic lockdown, I wanted to turn the bike tour into a chance to raise money for the Trussell Trust, whose food banks so many people rely on and which sadly is in even greater demand now as the severe economic hardship for many during this crisis intensifies.

I will be setting off on Sunday 19th July. I’ll provide updates throughout the bike tour on my dedicated Twitter account: https://twitter.com/phil50biketour

Thank you for anything you are able to give to help the Trussell Trust help those who most need it.

Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trust network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, the Trussell Trust can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Phil 50 bike tour (the story of my life)

Title: THE STAY SAFE SHOW

Description:
Inspired by other similar charity events I have decided to complete my staircase version of the three peaks challenge. Anyone who knows me will be familiar with my love of the mountains, obviously I can’t get out there at the moment, so I have decided to climb the equivalent combined  height of the highest peaks in Scotland, Wales and England (not Britain’s there highest peaks - they're all in Scotland). I’m trying to raise money for the Trussel Trust who provide much needed food banks across the country, sadly needed at the best of times but even more important at this time of crisis. Please help me.

I need to ascend 15,660 steps in total. That’s 1205 times up and down the stairs.

Scafell Pike 4500 steps, Snowdon 4610 steps, Ben Nevis 6550 steps.

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Title: Sophia Zarifis's Birthday

Description:
I'm taking part in the Stay At Home Sleepout to raise funds for people who are homeless and in poverty. The money raised will go towards supporting local food banks that help the homeless and vulnerable gain access to vital supplies.

Now more than ever there are millions of people relying on food banks to help feed themselves and their family, if you are in a position to help I would love if you could donate to help support the cause! 

What I'm actually doing:

Come 8PM June 1st I will be taking up residence in my back garden until the following morning, sleeping out in a sleeping bag. I am hoping that it doesn't rain otherwise it will be a very soggy experience indeed, however, even if it did, I have the luxury of going back inside the following morning, having a hot meal and a bath whereas the people we are hoping to help do not, they have no home. 

Anyone that knows me knows I hate shadowy places and things that go bump in the night so sleeping outside without the comfort of a tent is so not my thing! I will be posting updates throughout the night and hopefully be able to raise some money to help those in need! 

Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page :)
Title: CEO Sleepout

Description:
We have decided to have some fun, put down our screens and raise money for a well deserving cause. 

We are swimming 21 miles (33.8km) in our garden pool, that’s 5200 lengths. We are currently 7.7kms from Dover (virtually of course!) and we plan to reach Calais by the end of May!

We know we are a very fortunate family of four so we have decided to raise money for the Trussell Trust, who provide much needed food and basic supplies to families across the UK from their network of over 1,200 food banks.

The Trussell Trust

Title: Alun's 100 stairs a day challenge

Description:
In these unprecedented times, food banks will be more important than ever. Children that would have relied on free school meals may not receive them, thousands will lose jobs, and food poverty will undoubtedly rise. I've had my beloved beard for over five years and I've forgotten what my own face looks like. If I raise £200, I'll shave it off (and my girlfriend has agreed she can't leave me).

Trussell Trust's story:

Title: Sion's Shaving the Beard for Trussell Trust

Description:
“ No human should go to sleep without food “

We are two typical 15 year olds. We enjoy activities such as gaming, watching Netflix and hanging out with friends. However COVID-19 has changed everything around us, which also meant that we could not meet  each other and our friends in lockdown. This period of uncertainty made us realise that there are so many people out there who are not as fortunate as us, cannot even afford food and  starving for days ! These people need our urgent help in this Pandemic.

This is why we have decided to challenge ourselves to walk 40 km in a single day from Bourne End  to Reading on weekend of 25th July.

We have chosen to raise money for “The  Trussel trust “. We believe that they are the right organisation to help the hungry in these difficult times.

We would be very grateful if you can make a difference in their lives by supporting us on this  journey and save many lives  as every penny counts and every little helps. Thank you for reading our story and we hope you can help this noble cause. !

“ There is  no exercise better for the heart than reaching down and lifting people up “ very powerful line by John Holmes.

Thanks and regards

Sarth and Aditya

Description:
Action Hands is a community campaign launched during COVID19 by London Nursery Schools (LNS) founder Sara Brennan, Amanda Frolich and Alison Wheeler to support the well being of young children and families through music and play. 

With this song "Time To Shine", The Action Hands team is raising funds for the Trussell Trust to provide food for families in need during COVID19. 

Last year, Trussell Trust food banks provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. The Trussell Trust aims to end the need for food banks. As a nation, The Trussell Trust believes no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Thank you for watching our video Time To Shine.  

https://youtu.be/LcEJ-2WptvM

It is a cause very close to our hearts and we hope you can show your support for this worthy cause.  The song will be available soon to purchase and download on all the regular digital platforms.  All profits from the downloads will also go to The Trussell Trust.  

Keep safe everyone!

With love

Action Hands   

(Sara/Amanda/Alison)
Title: Action Hands -  Time To Shine

Description:
We’re both suckers for junk food and have decided to get healthier for a great cause!

From 1st May until 1st December 2020 we are giving up chocolate, biscuits, sweets and crisps! We don’t do anything by halves! 

Last year, Trussell Trust food banks provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics and during the Covid 19 crisis, food banks are under even more pressure.

With your help, we can replenish some of the extra food that has been needed during this time as the Trussell Trust works towards ending the need for food banks all together.

Title: Helen and Rosies Junk Food Detox!

Description:
After a mixture of wanting to take part in the charitable challenges, and also wanting to do something to help those less fortunate in these lockdown days days... I decided to set a challenge to some friends. There are several great efforts going on to raise money for the NHS charities, so I thought i’d go with something that is local to many of my friends and colleagues - this is the area right next to Dell Glasgow (remember that place!?)

Challenge is simple (but not easy!) & for the golfers out there, but anyone can try it!

Just like several similar challenges, the golfer needs to get 20 balls, place a bucket, basin or plant pot etc. 10 feet away. Film yourself hitting all 20 and for everyone you get in the bucket - donate (a minimum) of £2.00 to the just giving page below.

https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/carlo-cocozza

The idea is to get a lot of people taking part, so please post your video and nominate another garden golfer!

If you are tagged in this, you are nominated 😉 good luck!

Eg get 1 out of 20, donate £2 (or whatever you choose).
Get none in, donate at least £2 anyway. Every ‘ball in the bucket’ could be a meal for someone.

Description:
In this time of unprecedented crisis, many have lost their livelihoods and income meaning food security has become an even greater concern within our community and food banks are vital. 

In an effort to fundraise for The Trussell Trust food bank network I will be shaving my head and donating my hair to the Little Princess Trust who provide free, real hair wigs to children with hair loss and fund crucial research into childhood cancers. 

Unfortunately, given the current situation, the Little Princess Trust are understandably unable to receive hair donations and I won’t be able to shave my head until they can. 

However, considering the recent enforcements made to prevent virus spread, food aid is needed urgently and any donations, no matter the size, will be greatly appreciated by myself, The Trussell Trust and any person relying on food banks to stay safe and fed in this trying time. Even £2 can make a difference x

Title: Ollie and Tessa walk the Capital Ring

Description:
Over 30% of kids in Wales live in poverty, and in West Wales it’s getting worse. Fundraising isn’t the long term answer but right now it’s a small thing that I can do to help. So I’m going to walk over 30 miles by 9 November during our second lockdown in Wales. Trussell Trust runs my local food bank and does vital work to bring an end to child food poverty while providing emergency help to local people. 

If I reach my £500 target, my business, TogetherBetter, will match it. 

Thank you for supporting me to raise some money so that a few more families can eat tonight.
Title: Walking for child food poverty

Description:
Resources Bank: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1PMFxGTVwQmsL-4hMGhTKpr_I05RXvWzU?usp=sharing

Over the lockdown period, a group of medical students at Bristol Medical School contributed to making a bank of 100+ teaching powerpoints across a wide range of topics in Medicine. 

These were made by students for students in the time when all conventional methods of learning came to a standstill. It became much more than online peer-teaching sessions as, for some, it was the only point of contact for them to remain connected with people outside their households during the strictest lockdown period. 

While the project was running, as well as in hindsight, it was clear these informal powerpoints hold much more value than simple educational resources.

They will always serve as a reminder of what we can achieve when we come together. That it is possible to create something to be proud of even in the toughest of times. 

The creators of these wonderful resources have consented for their materials to be shared with other students who may benefit from them.

Please spare a donation as little or as much as you wish to support this amazing charity if you'd like access to the learning materials. OTR is a charity close to the hearts of many tutors who created the materials. 

Share it with friends and take a moment to check in with each other :)

** See photo gallery for examples of notes/topics **

About Off The Record Bristol

A mental health social movement by and for 11-25 year olds in Bristol and South Gloucestershire offering free and confidential services. OTR isn't just a charity providing mental health services, it's a mental health movement mobilised to support, promote and defend the mental health, rights and social position of young people!

Disclaimer:

The materials were created using the most accurate resources at the time, however, these may change with changes in the most up-to-date official guidelines. Therefore, these resources do not serve as official guidelines. Only to benefit medical students revision and better their understanding of the topic. 

Acknowledgements: This project involved a large cohort of tutors who made amazing contributions to the live teaching sessions. We'd like to express our gratitude to the tutors whose work may not be included in the bank due to consent/copyright materials. 

If you were involved in our project and would like to provide consent for the sharing of your work, then please get in touch via pn17313@bristol.ac.uk +/- provide a pdf. version of your work.

Creators:

Jedd Raidan, Emma Bache, Owain Powell, Antonis Tofias, Pam Nelson, Joseph Robertshaw, Orla Webster, Cerys Mack, Sion Russell, Josephine Rahman, Jemma Scattergood, Matthew Peakman, Chiranth Badrinath, Ella Smith, Tiffany Tuhirman, Julia Craggs, Aoife McCanny, Emma Hadley, Jack McAlinden, Hannah Cooney, Harvey Johnson, Molly Hardwick, Elanor Brooks, Lisa Dwyer-Joyce, Megan Jones, Khadija Meghrawi, Millicent Morris, Michelle Correa, Lelyn O. Atiemo, Catrin Masson, Roseanne Ismail, Callum Craig, Stephen Hodgson, Katie Driver., Sankalp Tandle.

This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. Title: Rogue are singing for their supper

Description:
On the 20th May 2020 join the Great British Fast for Food Banks

Donate the price of a meal (or more) to the Trussell Trust today!  


The national press have reported that, due to COVID-19, the number of people forced into hardship has increased.  Use of Food Banks has in some cases more than doubled. 

At the same time, due to the lockdown, donations have slowed.


We have to come together as a country and make sure support is there to protect people from food poverty during this emergency!


It also happens to be the month of Ramadan, when people of the Muslim faith refrain from eating and drinking from dawn to dusk.  Given the nature of the crisis, it seemed a fitting theme for this fundraising effort.


Please donate the price of a meal (or more) to the Trussell Trust today, and if you can, on Wednesday the 20th May 2020, people of all faiths and those of no faith, try and fast in support of those in the UK and around the world who are having to go without.



Once you have donated, tag in at least 5 of your friends and get them to join you in making this a huge national effort.


What does a fast entail?  Well, traditionally, going without food or drink from sunrise to sunset (Google can tell you the times).  If that seems a bit much, simply sacrifice whatever you are comfortable with, even if that's just your second Double Decker from the tuck shop at elevenses.


Of course, you don't have to fast if you don't want to, or if you have a medical condition, are taking medication, are pregnant, or really just find it too daunting an ordeal, please do not fast, but still please make whatever donation you feel comfortable making.


However much we raise for Food Banks is better than nothing!


Let's try to get these hashtags trending on social media with stories about what you are giving up, how your fast was, ideas, thoughts, videos and good wishes - and let's just see what happens.

#GreatBritishFast

#fast4foodbanks 


If this is successful as a campaign, perhaps we can run it again, maybe even one day a month, for as long as the Trussell Trust is needed in the UK to prevent people from falling into such hardship.


With Grace, who knows what we might achieve together.


The below is a message from the Trussell Trust so you can see the incredible work they do and the challenges they are facing.

.......

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.  Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank.
As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that they're able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Title: Donate to South-West Belfast Foodbank

Description:
Save the UK's Charities

General fundraising has been hit very hard by the COVID-19 pandemic. Thousands of fundraising events have been cancelled and many charities, particularly smaller ones, are struggling to maintain services because of this huge reduction in income.

This impacts all sectors of society  from children to the elderly  as well as the vital work in areas such as palliative care, serious diseases, mental health, housing support, food supplies and countless others that charities support.

I'm going to be taking on the Everesting challenge on Zwift. It's simple - climb 8,848m or the equivalent of Everest in one ride. You are only allowed to use one climb, which you have to ride up and down repeatedly to make the height gain.

 Alpe du Zwift is 516m at its peak. I'm expecting to have to ride the segment 16 or 17 times, equating to about 200km in the saddle. Zwift allows you to freewheel downhill, so loo breaks can be taken while "descending". Other than that, it's going to be hard work and the threat of a pretty numb bum.
Title: Dan is Everesting Alpe Du Zwift!

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

Everyone hates burpees. Fact. What began as a challenge between friends we hope can turn into something good that can raise funds for the Lewisham food bank who are doing amazing things to look after the most vulnerable in our local community.

So, we have set ourselves the challenge of doing 1,000 burpees (each) in a day. It won’t be easy but hopefully knowing we are making a difference to those who need it most during these tough times will get us through!

The Lewisham food bank is part of a network of over 400 food banks, working to tackle food poverty and hunger in our local community, as well as across the UK. They provide food to those in need - something of particular importance as we fight the current Coronavirus. 

We hope our efforts will help raise funds for the food bank and awareness of all the good they are doing within our local community. Any donations would be very much appreciated!

Title: Fundraising 2020

Description:
Feeding Families: Covid-19 Emergency Appeal

The ongoing lockdown is affecting us all, but for many families living in the slums of Kampala it has been devastating.

To meet this crisis, Kids Club Kampala - a small but ambitious and impactful charity, with a small team in the UK, and a team in Kampala employing local Ugandans - are running emergency food banks for vulnerable families to get them through this time.

They have already provided 982,107 emergency food packages, but need further help.

I have joined a collective challenge to run, skip and cycle the distance from here to Uganda along with a bigger team of about a dozen of us. We will be completing 1600 miles in total over a 10 week period. I have pledged to cover 200 miles by the end of August.

Each of us is aiming to raise £300 from our own networks and friends. We really appreciate any of your support especially during this uncertain time for everyone.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Title: Elizabeth's Keep on playing

Description:
While we're all stuck at home, I wanted to do something to put a smile on your face, and raise some money for the Trussell Trust. The national charity's network of food banks are expecting to see an increase in need over the coming weeks as the coronavirus pandemic unfolds.

To help, and hopefully(!) brighten up your day, I am dedicating my mornings to video call as many of you who donate as possible. All you need to do is donate to the Trussell Trust on this page, ensure your phone number is included in your donation, and tick that you are happy to receive further communications so that I am allowed to call you!

By donating, not only will you be in for the chance of a receiving a video call from me, but you will also help people struggling as a result of the coronavirus pandemic. 

Food banks were already seeing an increased need before this outbreak but it's likely that more people than ever will be unable to afford their own food over the coming weeks, especially people who have unstable jobs or who aren't eligible for sick pay, and will need to turn to a food bank for support. 

Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trust’s network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over half a million of these of these going to children. 

Your donations will help the Trussell Trust support food banks in their network and ensure people in crisis can access emergency food during this challenging time. This money could help fund vans to help food banks deliver food to people's homes, buy food (if necessary and available!), recruit additional staff to meet the demand, but also, vitally, campaign for change so that everyone can afford their own food. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and I look forward to chatting to a few of you over the coming days.

NOW FOR THE LEGAL PART: 

All funds raised will go directly to the Trussell Trust. You can find out more about the organisation on their website www.trusselltrust.org. 

I will try to call as many of you as possible but it might not be possible to speak to everyone who donates. 

Please note that I can only contact you if you provide a phone number and ‘opt in’ to share their details with the Trussell Trust. 

The Trussell Trust is committed to protecting your privacy and will process any personal data in accordance with the General Data Protection Act 2018. Your details will be kept safe and secure, only used by the Trussell Trust or those who work for us and will not be shared, sold or rented to third parties for marketing purposes. In this instance, your details (first name, phone number and amount donated), will be shared with Michael McIntyre for the purposes of this fundraising event only.

We may use information you provide for analysis, research or screening purposes in order to help us understand our supporters so that we can save resources and deliver the best possible service.

Title: Supporting FoodBank

Description:
Please join me on the Boxing Day 2019 from Midday for my charity stream to help raise as much money as we can for such an amazing cause.

You can find me at www.twitch.tv/nelinde

If you can't make a donation fear not! You can help by spreading the word and sharing this JustGiving page on social media and with friends and family.


No one should go hungry, especially at Xmas! 

Yet thousands of families are going without food due to poverty, parents going without so their children don't have empty bellies.

This is 2019! This shouldn't even be a thing... Sadly so many people in the UK are in this dire situation. It could be a neighbour or even a family member!

UK Food Banks are vastly overstretched and are in need of food donations more than ever before to meet the highest demands ever to be recorded since the Trussell Trust started in 1999!


But you can help spread a little Xmas cheer <3 


Please spare what you can afford, as little as £2 can afford a single meal!

You can also help by donating any spare "long shelf life" foods such as tinned vegetables etc to your local Food Bank or supermarket Food Bank collection box <3

Having personally relied on my local Food Bank in previous times of hardship I have first hand experience of the effect and contribution Food Banks have on so many people facing financial hardship and not being able to afford food for their families or themselves. They provide a light in times of darkness, often providing much more than just food. 

They offer an ear to listen, a personal connection where there is nothing but loneliness. Many Food Banks even provide clothing that they've had donated. My local Food Bank even run a free playgroup where parents can go to meet other parents and make friendships.

I can't stress how much a small donation can help <3






Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

Title: 100km in a Day Cycle Challenge

Description:
I set this page up for last year's marathon but it was then cancelled and this year's one moved to October. 

Before Christmas 2020 I read a lot about food banks in the UK and found it quite shocking. Not a lot has changed now and so I want to try to raise some more money. There are more people using them than ever in many parts of the country, and the Trussell Trust support a nationwide network of over 1200 food banks. They provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK.

Between April 2019 and March 2020, food banks in the Trussell Trust network provided a record 1.9 million food supplies to people in crisis, an 18% increase on the previous year and during the coronavirus pandemic food banks have seen need rise even further.

I know I have run the marathon before, and I know I have asked for donations before. But this seems like a really worthy cause and an issue that worries me a lot so I hope people will find a few spare quid to donate. I will definitely top up the final total myself too as I feel in a very fortunate to be running the London Marathon and want to complete the race knowing it has also done some good. 

If you are a UK taxpayers and want to sponsor me please tick the Gift Aid box. This enables them to claim an extra 25p per £1 you donate at no extra cost to you. A £10 donation will be transformed into £12.50 and makes a huge difference so please do so. 

Many thanks 

Jeffers

Description:
Initially, I was going to do a fasting campaign as a gesture of how unacceptable it is that our government has just voted to take food away from children, but the feedback I got was that you lovely folks would be more supportive of something that was better for me. So, instead I settled on going without alcohol for a month; much easier, but much healthier.

Rather than just asking other people for money, however, I'm also going to pay in the price of a pint (£4 per day) to my own fundraiser throughout November, up to a total of £120. If I'm living clean, sober and hangover-free, then I figure I should also have more time and resources to commit to helping similar good causes.

Having said that, any help you can provide, either by donating or sharing this link, is obviously gratefully received also :)

Title: No child should go hungry. Help children receive free meals at half term.

Description:
During Covid, I was worried for my 80-year-old grandma who was left in India alone. This drove me to  create something that made lonely people feel part of a community. And so, Alone Together was born. For this book, I reached out to over 70 people across the globe; people of different ages, race and regions to send me a special picture of how they were handling lockdown. This project is a symbol of people’s gratitude for the simple things in life. I wanted to share the joy that I experienced to be alone together. 

The mission of the Felix Project is simple - to take surplus food from their suppliers and deliver it to any charity that helps feed people. It's all nutritious and would otherwise go to waste. Not only that, but it helps fight food poverty and reduces costs for hardworking organisations.
Title: Alone Together

Description:
ARE YOU WORRIED ABOUT INTEREST IN YOU BANK ACCOUNT?
Zaytun Welfare Trust can relive you, your business, organisation, institution or mosque of this burden. Its aim is to raise awareness of bank interest, and collect it’s to support social welfare projects.
Some Muslim scholars had previously advised Muslims not accept interest from the banks, as it is haram. But many prominent scholars now consider in more sinful to leave interest money with the banks, because this money is often used for un-Islamic activities.
Their fatwah instruct Muslims to give the interest from their bank accounts to a Muslim charitable cause, rather than telling the bank not to give them interest.
As there are no blessings in interest, people should not expect rewards for donations of interest money rather it must be seen as a way of avoiding a major sin.
Title: ARE YOU WORRIED ABOUT INTEREST IN YOU BANK ACCOUNT?

There are 1.3 million children registered for free school meals in the UK who rely on these daily nutritional meals supplied by their schools. Whilst this provision supports many children UNICEF reported in 2017 that one in three children in the UK are in multi-dimensional poverty, with one in five children suffering from food insecurity.Whilst these statistics show that there are so many vulnerable children in need in the UK, the recent school closures and lock down procedures for Covid-19 have meant that these free school meals have not been as accessible. The Food Foundation estimates that 200,000 UK children are skipping meals due to families not being able to access food and that an estimated 325,000 of the 1.3 million children registered for free school meals have had no support since school closures were announced.Around 4 million UK children now live in families that cannot afford to follow the government guidelines for a healthy diet. The first public report of this data
Title: Big Food Fundraiser

Description:
I'm taking part in Quit for a bit for Alzheimer's Society. Every pound I raise will help beat dementia. It will be a tough challenge because biscuits, sweets and cakes are what most people (including me!) eat almost every single day. I would like to do this not only for the challenge and raising money for Alzheimer's Society but also because I'd like to do it for my Nana. Thank you for taking the time to read this!

Chloe :)
Title: Chloe

Description:
Quit For A Bit is the Alzheimer’s Society fundraising mission for November encouraging people to give up alcohol and sugar for their cause.

I got rather fat during lockdown from comfort eating! What better way to lose the belt overhang than being sponsored to do it and raising money for a good cause. If I get pledges totaling over £150 I'll do it for the whole of December too. <== oh dear, this has happened, no mince pies!

Stopping alcohol and sugar may sound easy, but I love Polish beer and food of all kinds. I will be giving up all alcohol, cake, puddings, biscuits, sweets, chocolate, sugared drinks and I'll throw in crisps to make it super difficult.

My mum died a few years back from dementia related illness. I think she'd approve of what I'm doing.

Alzheimer’s Society is transforming the landscape of dementia forever. Until the day we find a cure, we will create a society where those affected by dementia are supported and accepted, able to live in their community without fear or prejudice.
Title: Andy's Torturous Quit For A Bit

Title: Amy's Sumpter family 100km cycle or run in November

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

What We Plan To Do

My partner, Corinne, and I have had an idea for a bit of a walk that combines our wish to raise funds and awareness about an amazing charity thats doing fantastic work in these troubled times with our love of cricket and in particular the local rivalry between the red rose of Lancashire and white of Yorkshire. 

#WalkOfTheRoses

So, we plan to walk the 43 miles (69Km) from Old Trafford Cricket Ground, Manchester (home of Lancashire), over The Pennines to Headingley Cricket Ground in Leeds (home of Yorkshire) in a day. We also thought this wasn't quite hard enough so we are planning to do it in winter, because walking over The Pennines in winter is always a barrel of laughs :) Oh, and then because of Covid restrictions we will do it unsupported, just the two of us, no one turning up with cups of coffee and cake every so often. That's got to be worth a donation hasn't it?

Why We Are Doing It

Where do I start with this? As those who know me will be aware I'm not one to hold back with my views and tend to take the Bob Geldof "give us your %$£&ing money" approach to fund raising. So, lets just leave this as people are struggling, families are striuggling, kids are struggling. its not just the unemployed, the disabled and, for want of a better phrase, the usual suspects, but its the the low paid, those who are fuloughed, people facing rising costs and lower pay, those facing redundancy and an uncertain future. Its children - that's what has really got me, its kids going hungry in the 6th richest economy in the world. And, maybe, whats even worse is that this isn't even a Covid thing, this has been happenening for longer but Covid, the restrictions, the changes to our economy is making it worse and worse.

And, quite frankly, Fare Share are trying to do something about it - so thats why we are fundraising for them.

Description:
CJD is a horrid disease. It doesn’t only affect the person suffering from this horrid disease but it leaves families devastated in the wake. 

CJD takes important people - We need a cure. As soon as possible. 

One month being vegan.

Support us to find a cure for Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (CJD). There is currently no cure but every day scientists and doctors are getting closer to finding a treatment. We aim to raise funds to support the use of an antibody drug developed for the treatment of patients with CJD. The first patient was treated at UCLH in October 2018.
Title: Melissa's Vegan Challenge page

Description:
Please note - this fund is for all NHS workers who would like to donate. Or, if you'd like to support public sector workers and your local community, please feel free to donate too! 

I know the NHS has already done (more than) enough during the pandemic, but it is hard to stand by when 1.3 million children may struggle without access to Free School Meals during the school holidays. Let's stand in solidarity with our colleagues in education, social care and local government, who have worked tirelessly to protect and serve vulnerable individuals during COVID-19. Anything you can give, big or small, is appreciated. 

Dear my fellow NHS colleagues, 

Thanks very much for taking the time to visit this page. 

If you don't know me - #HelloMyNameIs Beth. I'm an alumnus of NHS Graduate Management Training Scheme (GMTS) and a current NHS worker. 

Five years ago, I chose to pursue a career in healthcare because of my belief in, and alignment to the six NHS values: (1) Working together for patients (2) Respect and dignity (3) Commitment to quality of care (4) Compassion (5) Improving lives (6) Everyone counts 

My motivation for applying to the graduate scheme and joining the NHS was not unique. In fact, every single NHS worker I know chose to join the health service because of how powerfully these values resonated with them. 

Consequently, I am certain many of my NHS colleagues will share my discomfort and frustration at the government’s decision to end free school meal vouchers during the school holidays. 

How can we work together for patients, when we are potentially letting the children of our workforce go hungry? 

How can we champion respect and dignity, when our most vulnerable children have not been treated as such? 

How can we advocate a commitment to quality of care, when we are unable to meet a child’s most basic needs? 

How can we practice compassion, when as a society we have punished children for a situation that they cannot control? 

How can we improve lives, without the most basic baseline on which to improve? 

How can we say that everyone counts, when the needs of those most innocent and defenceless do not seem to count at all? 

However, these six values are also why I am certain that my fellow NHS GMTS and colleagues will want to take action against this disappointing decision. 

Hopefully, our NHS community will provide a great network in which to fundraise for FareShare UK an organisation which redistributes food to help charities, local communities and vulnerable people. 

Please, please, please donate and share this link amongst your network. There are millions of people employed by the NHS - the smallest donations could all add up! 

If you would like to, please leave your name, region, Trust (if you wish) and year you started in your NHS career, so we can see how far we can get this to spread! 

Thanks again everyone for your amazing work - stay safe and keep well x

In Memory of Meherban Khan

Aameen

I have made a pledge to ride over 350 miles in hope to raise awareness and raise money for Winter Packs which will help provide Food, Cash, Clothing, Fuel and Blankets for Our Less Fortunate Brothers and Sisters of Syria, Yemen, Gaza, India, Albania, Bangladesh, Pakistan and Kashmir. Ummah Welfare Trust is the Charity I have chose to use because they have a 100% Donation Policy.

‘The example of the Believers in their mutual love, mercy and compassion for one another is like one body; if one limb complains then the whole body responds to it in restlessness and fever.’ [Sahih Muslim]The balance of wealth and justice remains absent in the world today. For at least three quarters of the world’s population, poverty is a fact of life. Hunger, sickness, homelessness and more cast a heavy shadow over their lives as they struggle to survive with little or no support.Ummah Welfare Trust formed as an NGO in 2001 with the goal of challenging this state of affairs. Inspired by the Islamic teachings of empathy and selflessness, the charity would strive to support and uplift the impoverished through the beautiful act of charity.

Title: Hygiene Bank Harpenden and St Albans

Description:
"Globally, more than 820 million people go to bed hungry every day. Even more one in three suffer from some form of malnutrition.

Millions of people, who already live a subsistence lifestyle and rely on daily wages have been plunged into poverty as a result of the economic impact of Coronavirus. Humanity First has supported by:

- Distributing warm meals and family ration packs including staples such as rice, bread, pasta, pulses, noodles and other items based on local cultural norms

- Assisting homeless, refugees and stateless people who have been a lower priority in national action plans

- Collaborating with local charities, governments and international aid agencies to work together to support more families


You donations can:

£12 - Gives 1 month supply of food to a hungry child

£36 - Gives a child a lifeline: 3 months worth of food assistance.

£60 - Will provide a family with one WFP food box, containing food for a family for an entire month.

Description:
For two years we have been supporting families with basic items and clothing for babies and toddlers. Since the start of the pandemic we have spent a large amount of money on nappies and other items for families. The funding has now run out and the need has become greater so we are consolidating our work and setting up a baby bank which will support babies and toddlers from 0-2.

Newham has the highest number of children living in poverty and we want to do all we can to support families to have the basics to make life a little more manageable.

The Salvation Army is a Christian Church & registered Charity working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, homeless people, all adult victims of modern slavery and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction.

Description:
Life is bleak at the best of times even when we believe that we have the power to change our own lives. A new job, a new home, a new relationship - those choices are possible even when it feels like there is no hope.

But what if you're not in a position to make a change? Whether it's due to disabilities, mental health issues or simply existing in this country as a child, sometimes people do not have the opportunity to make their own change.

Or to eat as often as they should.

I can't make a big difference in this world, but I can make a start. Hence this donation page, a small attempt to make life better for the most vulnerable.

I'm not doing a marathon or skydiving or walking to John o'Groats, I'm just asking you to dip into your pocket and give to an amazing organisation who are doing their best to ensure that people in need have access to food.

To entice, I'm going to give away a (used) but still very much working Nintendo Switch, complete with two games - Mario Kart and Super Mario Odyssey. 

Anyone who donates by midnight on November 22nd will be entered into a random draw with the 'winner' being sent the Switch (UK only for the draw, but feel free to donate if you're from overseas)

There will be no special weighting in the draw for bigger donations - every penny counts to a cause like this, but even in these gloomy times, if you have a spare fiver or tenner hanging about, please consider donating here.

We've all seen the incredible work from the likes of Marcus Rashford recently in trying to help children, you know, actually not starve, and the sadly predictable response from the UK government,

All we can do as humans is to do our own bit, and this is one opportunity for that.

More about The Trussell Trust here 👇

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Description:
I will be taking part in a sponsored walk across the most iconic bridges in London to help raise vital funds for pregnant Syrian refugee women and their new-born babies.

My target is to try and raise a minimum of £200 but if we can go above this then all the better. The money raised will go towards providing free medical care to our pregnant Syrian refugee sisters and their new-born babies. We all know how important this is, our sisters need the support and our babies deserve a chance that so many of us take for granted.

By donating to my page will go towards Islamic help project in Jordan. They have a birth clinic there that helps:

£20 – This donation provides a baby with new clothes and essentials.
£30 – This donation provides routine health checks for a pregnant woman.
£300 – Covers Cost of Birth (baby delivery) And Family
Aftercare 
£600 – Covers Cost of a C Section birth (baby delivery) and family aftercare

For more information please check out Islamic Help website:  

https://www.islamichelp.org.uk/birth-clinic/


Click the link to see Islamic Helps Birth Campaign video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ARdWBUGBqZs


Thank You.



Islamic Help is a UK-registered charity delivering sustainable solutions that empower people in need. Our work is underpinned by our core values – honesty, transparency, integrity and accountability.Since launch, we've empowered over 10 million people worldwide.Over the past 17 years, we have provided urgent aid and sustainable relief to thousands of disadvantaged people across the globe, including right here in the UK.
Title: 10 Bridge Trek

Description:
In November and December of 2020 we , as a regional team, will commit to and travel 2673 miles under our own steam. This will be GPS tracked on Strava so you can follow our pain and celebrate our achievements (maybe) all safe in the knowledge that we aren't cheating by shaking our Fitbits ....as if we would eh?!

2673 miles will get us to Bethlehem before Christmas Day, not exactly the three wise men I grant you but that’s the kind of distance that we will collectively travel by adding our activities together. That’s also over 5.5 million steps or 4447 km for the metric lovers 

We need to remind Covid 19 that it can't stop us supporting others and this is how we will do so with your generous help.

All you need to do is donate to our JustGiving page remembering to leave your store name or your name and a message so we can stop hassling you for support (money) 😉

Title: Suraya's Quit For A Bit

Description:
iQra FC have accepted to play against SOS FC (Shoot on sight) in a friendly charity match to raise funds in order to send food packs to Bangladesh.

iQra FC vs SOS FC

DETAILS

  • Location: Beckton Power League
  • Date: Sunday 26th October 2020
  • Time: 2PM Kick off
  • 7 a side and 2 subs allowed

Since early June, monsoon related floods have affected millions of people in south and east Asia and the worst afflicted being Bangladesh, where more than a quarter of the country has been inundated. Please help us to create awareness and funds.

Emergency Flood Appeal in Bangladesh -  A THIRD OF BANGLADESH IS FLOODED!

Since early June, monsoon-related floods have affected millions of people in the south and east Asia and the worst afflicted being Bangladesh where more than a quarter of the country has been flooded. Officials have reported that 4 million people have been affected and near a hundred people have died from this disaster.

Every year there is flooding during the monsoon season in Bangladesh but this is the worst in decades. The situation has made life very hard for many, especially farmers who depend on their livestock.

One farmer mentioned how 'the water kept on rising'. He, his family nor his cattle could go out. They needed a small boat to get about. They could not cook on their cooker or sleep on their own beds as it has gone underwater. This is just a story of one farmer. Can you imagine how many stories you will hear when talking to the 1 million people who have had to move away from their homes as there's nothing left.

The flooding has ruined crops and people's livelihoods even for what little they had. Now more than a million are on the move.

Bangladesh's Flood Forecast Centre has warned the situation could get worse with major rivers expecting to rise in the coming days.

This is why iQra International Bangladesh team have been on the ground assisting and helping as many people as they possibly can with medical kits, food, household supplies and more. Please help iQra International with your continuous support.

iQra International useful packages:

Food Pack (month) - £50

Emergency Medical Aid - £75

Household Goods (pots and pans) - £100

House Repair - £175

Wheelchair - £100

10 Water Filter - £100

Tube well - £250

Sponsor a Child (year) - £300

Please donate as generously as you can, please share this and finally make prayer that iQra International can help and overcome this hardship for millions of people.

It is super easy to get involved and help, you can pay using these mentioned below just follow the simple steps:

  • -Apple Pay
  • -Google Pay
  • -Debit Card Payment

Or you can Bank Transfer to the details below:

  • iQra International
  • Sort Code: 20-57-06
  • Account no: 90400203
  • Barclays Bank

*Please use the package as a reference.

If you made it here, Thank you so much! It means a lot to us that you are engaged and have the intention to help. Remember if you cant help by donating you can still help with the following tips below:

1. Share this on your social media stories every day!

2. Try to raise a small amount between family and friends together.

Thank you!
Title: Charity Football Match iQra FC vs SOS FC

Description:
I was supposed to be going to Memusi school last July but because of Covid I couldn’t go. I decided to do this challenge to make up for the loss of the trip. I’m excited and nervous for this challenge but it will be fun to have this experience. Hopefully next year I will be able to go to the school and get to see the children  and help all I can.

About Memusi’s Lived in Experience:

This is a Fundraising opportunity where people can take on the challenge to live on the food that a Magadian Child would live on for 3 days. The irony in this challenge is that it cannot be done properly; we looked at the food that a child would typically eat in a day and this is not something that any adult could survive on. We have however with advice from a nutritionist pulled together a list of food that a person can take on the challenge with, living as close to this as possible.

List of Food (per day):

- Water

- No more than 2 cups of tea

- 1 portion of fruit (Orange or Mango preferable)

- 2 Slices of Bread

- One portion of Rice

- 2 Potatoes

- 1 portion of Cabbage

- 2 Carrots

- 1 Cup of Beans 

If you are struggling you could also include a portion of lean meat.

NB: Having sought advice from a Nutritionist, this is half of a persons daily calorie intake (hence why we are only recommending 3 days). 



Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Gabbys Memusi Lived in Experience

Description:
Shakil and I will be taking on the Virtual Athens Marathon on Saturday 21st November to support two Charities, mine which is the Trussell Trust and Shakil's which is Cooking Champions. Both these charities aim to reduce hunger in our communities. 

You can follow our journey on Instagram @jkm87_running and @shak_active

Nobody chooses a life that requires support from a food bank, a series of events will have occurred that led them their, some of which some will say are choices but I think in the majority of cases society will have led them down those paths leaving very little real decision making down to the individual. 

However someone got there they deserve support and compassion to help change their future. Having food is a basic human right, not a luxury. Are you aware of just how much support is needed where you live? All may not be as well as it seems. 

What your donation could do:

  • £10 could help give a parent peace of mind that their family
    will not go hungry tonight. 
  • £20 could help support someone take their first
    steps out of poverty. 
  • £50 could help us give more people a place to turn to in
    times of crisis.

If you are unable to support financially right now, that's ok. Maybe you can pick up just one extra thing each time you shop and put it in the collection points, most major supermarkets will have them near the checkouts. That 50p bag of pasta can go along way. 

What they do:

We support a nationwide network of food banks and together we provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK.

In the UK, more than 14 million people are living in poverty – including 4.5 million children. We support more than 1,200 food bank centres in the UK to provide a minimum of three days’ nutritionally-balanced emergency food to people who have been referred in crisis, as well as support to help people resolve the crises they face. Between April 2019 and March 2020, food banks in our network provided a record 1.9 million food supplies to people in crisis, an 18% increase on the previous year.

We know it takes more than food to end hunger. That’s why we bring together the experiences of food banks in our network to challenge the structural economic issues that lock people in poverty, and campaign to end the need for food banks in the UK.

Read some stories here on how the trust is supporting those that need it https://www.trusselltrust.org/what-we-do/real-stories/
Title: Jo & Shakil's Athens Virtual Marathon 2020 page

Description:
Be part of Loving Humans campaign to eradicate hunger and ensure that everyone gets fed and no one sleeps hungry. Hunger kills and the statistics are shocking. 
You may feel like a drop in the bucket. But every drop counts! Your change can change lives, your change can make a change.
Your contribution can help achieve a solution.
Title: NextGen's Food for Life

Description:
This is my first ever 10 kilometer run - I don't think I've ever run this far in my life!

St Martin's is my parish church, and also a place that is deeply concerned with supporting the local community.  It runs a weekly food hub, supporting those in need which is excellent. I want to all support the work that St Martin's does.
Title: Supporting the work of the parish of St. Martin's, Knowle

Description:
Hi, I'm Dan and I've decided to cycle from Clitheroe to Bicester to Redhill (260+miles) to raise money for Action Against Hunger. I'll be setting off on October 24th and hope to reach Redhill at some point the following day. It is a cycling tour in honour of Britain's greatest Olive/Plant-based manufacturing sites! I'll be doing this on my own, unsupported, in what is likely to be testing weather conditions. I can't say I'm looking forward to it to be honest...but it is for a fantastic cause!

Action Against Hunger is a global humanitarian organisation whose mission is to create a world free from hunger. Right now, that mission is more difficult than ever, due to the dramatic impact of Covid-19 on charities’ fundraising. But this mission is also more important than ever, as the threat of coronavirus hits the world’s most vulnerable communities, like those living in refugee camps where social distancing is simply not possible.

Some examples of how your donations could help:

  • £25 could fund an emergency kitchen kit for a family of 5 people
  • £42 could save the life of a severely malnourished child through a course of ready-to-use therapeutic foods
  • £110 could provide chlorine tablets to ensure safe drinking water for 833 peoples for 20 days during an epidemic

Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. By donating you're supporting an extremely worthy cause and helping some of the worlds most vulnerable people in dire need. 

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: The Compleat Food Cycle 2020

Description:
I'm taking part in Quit for a bit for Alzheimer's Society. Every pound I raise will help beat dementia.

Anyone who knows me well will know how difficult it will be to give up sweets, chocolate, biscuits, cake and deserts for the whole of November but that is nothing compared to the difficulty and distress that a person with dementia experiences 365 days of the year.

Thank you for sponsoring me!

Description:
I’ve been challenged to do a food eating challenge by friends so I’m hoping to make it into a charitable event to raise some much needed moneys for a well deserved local hospice. 

Myself and chandler are going to be taking on the dreaded “suströming” rotten fermented fish eating challenge. Trust me when I say neither of us are looking forward to attempting this challenge, it is however for a great cause so please please help us help them by donating anything you can to help those who need it the most. 

It’s not going to be easy to watch us both undergo this challenge as most people who’ve attempted this normally get covered in vomit!  Yes vomit, this apparent delicacy is one of the worlds most smelliest dishes so be warned! 

We are both going to donate our stomachs and hopefully raise a decent chunk of money to help this much needed hospice. So please again anything is better than nothing so please dig deep🙏🏻 And share our post to raise awareness and hopefully raise more funds. 

We would both like to thank you for any donations, but don’t wish to thank the friends who have challenged us to do this revolting deed. 

WATCH THIS SPACE xxx
Title: PAUL & Chandlers food challenge.

Description:
I'm taking part in Quit for a bit for Alzheimer's Society. Every pound I raise will help beat dementia.

Throughout November I will be trying to avoid sugary foods and snacks and as an extra challenge I had a sober October!! I have another target too ...I'm hoping to run 5K or even better 10K on the 4th December , the Alzheimer's Society's 'Elf Day'! I may even dress up as an elf!

 My lovely mum Annie died 12 years ago. She lived with Alzheimer's for the last few years of her life but always had a smile on her face and made us laugh. At that time there was very little support for people living with dementia and as one of her carers I found it hard to find advice and help.

Hopefully things are changing but times are hard for those living with dementia and the pandemic has increased pressures on carers too. Every penny raised will help to fund research and provide support for those living with dementia and for their carers too. 

Thank you for sponsoring me!
Title: Catherine
